wikipedia_page.main:
2nd Lieutenant Leonard James Moon (9 February 1878 – 23 November 1916) was a cricketer  and footballer who played first-class cricket for Cambridge University from 1897 to 1900 and Middlesex County Cricket Club from 1899 to 1909. He also played four Test matches for England against South Africa in 1905-06. He also played for Fulham as a centre forward throughout 1897.
Moon was educated at Westminster School and Pembroke College, Cambridge. After university he became a schoolmaster.
He died of wounds suffered while fighting near Salonica in Greece, as a lieutenant with the Devon Regiment in the First World War. He is buried in Karasouli Military Cemetery (grave A189).His brother, Billy Moon, was also a cricketer and represented England at football.
